He also encouraged state and local governments to pay $100 to people to get vaxxed. </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/29/us-economy-surges-prepandemic-levels-comes-lower-forecasts?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The US Economy Has Its Revenge
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="John Wick gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=282 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/27bPvfGBYcaxqMSyCZ/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="John Wick gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/27bPvfGBYcaxqMSyCZ/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a turnaround that seemed unthinkable as we were scrambling for toilet paper last March, the US economy has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/us-gdp-economic-growth-first-quarter-2021-11627508180?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">returned</a> to its pre-pandemic size in Q2, according to the GDP report released yesterday by the government.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It shows that vaccinations + businesses reopening + sustained government support = a recipe for supercharged growth. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If that’s the parade, here’s a little rain: The 6.5% annual growth rate last quarter fell below forecasts, showing there are still some mustard stains on the economy’s T-shirt.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s going well<strong style="color:#000"></strong>
</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">You: </strong></span><span>Give yourself a pat on the back, because </span><span><em>you</em></span><span>, the American consumer, helped drive the recovery. Consumer spending </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-29/u-s-gdp-trails-forecast-even-as-consumer-spending-surges?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased 11.8% annually</a></span><span>, the second-biggest growth spurt since 1952.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Business investment: </strong></span><span>Companies feeling emboldened by stronger demand poured money into equipment and developing intellectual property. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s not working <strong style="color:#000"></strong>
</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Supply chain snags: </strong></span><span>Apple and Tesla this week </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-tesla-to-take-hit-from-chip-shortage-a-sign-of-problems-intensity-11627474416?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joined the chorus</a></span><span> of companies warning that the chip shortage was hurting their businesses. Meanwhile, </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/07/27/supply-chains-freight-rail-ports/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">logjams</a></span><span> persist in ports around the world, leading to shipping delays and inventory crunches for US companies.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Where are the workers? </strong></span><span>If you’ve read the Brew over the last, oh, six months, you know that businesses are struggling to hire workers, which means they’re not able to meet customer demand. “The very tight labor market has resulted in our company not growing while there are plenty of growth opportunities,” one Texas business owner </span><span><a href="https://www.dallasfed.org/research/surveys/tssos/2021/2107.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew#tab-comments" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the Dallas Fed</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And what about the D-word? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That is, how will the spread of the Delta variant affect the economy going forward? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“We’re just going to have to watch,” Fed Chair Jerome Powell <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2021/07/28/powell-fed-inflation-delta/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said this week</a>. But in general, he thinks with high vaccination rates the “effects will probably be less. There probably won’t be significant lockdowns.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The US economy took a gut punch from the global pandemic and came out with vital signs intact, if a little bruised. And depending on the length and severity of the recent Covid spike, Delta may prove another big test. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/29/scarlett-johansson-sues-disney-black-widow-streaming-release?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Disney vs. an Actual Avenger
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/29/scarlett-johansson-sues-disney-black-widow-streaming-release?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Black Widow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81OTY2L2JsYWNrX3dpZG93LmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Disney</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Scarlett Johansson is taking on her most challenging role yet: plaintiff. Yesterday, the movie star <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/scarlett-johansson-disney-lawsuit-1234990249/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed</a> a lawsuit against Disney, claiming the company violated her agreement with Marvel that guaranteed <em>Black Widow</em> an exclusive theatrical release.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Earlier this month, Disney released the movie in theaters and on its streaming service Disney+ for an additional $30. <em>Black Widow</em> earned $80 million at its opening weekend at the box office, a record for pandemic times, but not great for a Marvel movie.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For reference, </span><span><em>Spiderman: Far From Home</em></span><span> (2019) brought in $185 million during its first weekend.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But <em>Black Widow </em>made a lot of money outside of theaters—$60 million from Disney+. And seeing all that $$$ ticked Johansson off: Her salary is largely tied to box office performance, which may have been siphoned off by the simultaneous at-home release. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Disney <a href="https://variety.com/2021/film/news/disney-scarlett-johansson-black-widow-lawsuit-response-pandemic-1235030837/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">responded</a> to Johansson by saying the lawsuit was "especially sad and distressing in its callous disregard for the horrific and prolonged global effects of the COVID-19 pandemic."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Companies like Disney have thrown tens of billions into the streaming wars. The ScarJo case shows that the pivot to streaming has second-order effects—like how actors should be paid—that entertainment giants have yet to grapple with.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/29/drop-demand-mask-sales-rebound?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
More Asks for Masks
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="earth with a mask on" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81OTYzL3dvcmxkX21hc2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We're not at the free Peloton for a month stage of the new Covid wave yet, but lots more people are updating their mask collection.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sales of face masks <a href="https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-30a5f9b1cf1fd79d278f2401fb233134?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged 24%</a> for the week ending Tuesday, according to the Adobe Digital Economy Index. Analysts expect mask sales to jump even more after the CDC issued new guidance that encourages vaccinated people to wear masks indoors in Covid hotspots.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">After a drop in demand, they're making a comeback</strong>: Masks, which had accounted for 14% of gross merchandise sales on Etsy in Q2 2020, fell to a 3% share in Q1 this year. But after the new CDC guidance was released…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Searches for the term “masks” doubled on Google. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Citigroup, Apple stores, Disney World, and Disneyland moved quickly to require masks again.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Other retailers, juggling confused customers and anxious employees, are still waiting and watching.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But the boom times are probably over.</strong> 3M, the manufacturer of N95 masks, said global demand reached its peak in Q1 2021. And although the worsening situation has sparked renewed interest in face coverings, analysts think even the recent surge in sales isn’t likely to vault the pandemic staple past the peak reached earlier.</p>

<img alt="Chart showing poverty rates" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81OTY0L2NoYXJ0X3Nob3dpbmdfcG92ZXJ0eV9yYXRlcy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Poverty in the US will be <a href="https://www.urban.org/research/publication/2021-poverty-projections-assessing-impact-benefits-and-stimulus-measures?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut by 45%</a> this year thanks to the massive government intervention during the pandemic, meaning 20 million fewer people are in poverty now than in 2018. The decline in poverty over the last three years is almost 3x the previous record drop. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“In our view, ending the sales of ice cream in the occupied territories is one of the most important decisions the company has made in its 43-year history.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bennett Cohen and Jerry Greenfield, who founded Ben & Jerry’s ice cream in 1978, wrote in the NYT that they “<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/28/opinion/ben-and-jerry-israel.html?campaign_id=4&emc=edit_dk_20210729&instance_id=36549&nl=dealbook&regi_id=83342785&segment_id=64759&te=1&user_id=6e8f5c5256f51c870f4df90ca819260d" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unequivocally support</a>” the company’s controversial decision to stop sales in Israeli-occupied areas while emphasizing they are proud Jews, who support the State of Israel. The two have relinquished operational control of the company since 2000.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>For decades, poppers have been the go-to sex drug for gay men. But where do they come from? (<a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/davidmack/poppers-factory?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">BuzzFeed News</a>)</p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a turnaround that seemed unthinkable as we were scrambling for toilet paper last March, the US economy has \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/us-gdp-economic-growth-first-quarter-2021-11627508180?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereturned\u003c/a\u003e to its pre-pandemic size in Q2, according to the GDP report released yesterday by the government.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt shows that vaccinations + businesses reopening + sustained government support = a recipe for supercharged growth. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf that’s the parade, here’s a little rain: The 6.5% annual growth rate last quarter fell below forecasts, showing there are still some mustard stains on the economy’s T-shirt.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s going well\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\n\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYou: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGive yourself a pat on the back, because \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eyou\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the American consumer, helped drive the recovery. Consumer spending \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-29/u-s-gdp-trails-forecast-even-as-consumer-spending-surges?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased 11.8% annually\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the second-biggest growth spurt since 1952.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBusiness investment: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCompanies feeling emboldened by stronger demand poured money into equipment and developing intellectual property. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s not working \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\n\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSupply chain snags: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eApple and Tesla this week \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-tesla-to-take-hit-from-chip-shortage-a-sign-of-problems-intensity-11627474416?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejoined the chorus\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of companies warning that the chip shortage was hurting their businesses. Meanwhile, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/07/27/supply-chains-freight-rail-ports/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elogjams\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e persist in ports around the world, leading to shipping delays and inventory crunches for US companies.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhere are the workers? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf you’ve read the Brew over the last, oh, six months, you know that businesses are struggling to hire workers, which means they’re not able to meet customer demand. “The very tight labor market has resulted in our company not growing while there are plenty of growth opportunities,” one Texas business owner \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.dallasfed.org/research/surveys/tssos/2021/2107.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew#tab-comments\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the Dallas Fed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd what about the D-word? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat is, how will the spread of the Delta variant affect the economy going forward? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“We’re just going to have to watch,” Fed Chair Jerome Powell \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2021/07/28/powell-fed-inflation-delta/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid this week\u003c/a\u003e. But in general, he thinks with high vaccination rates the “effects will probably be less. There probably won’t be significant lockdowns.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe US economy took a gut punch from the global pandemic and came out with vital signs intact, if a little bruised. And depending on the length and severity of the recent Covid spike, Delta may prove another big test. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eScarlett Johansson is taking on her most challenging role yet: plaintiff. Yesterday, the movie star \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/scarlett-johansson-disney-lawsuit-1234990249/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled\u003c/a\u003e a lawsuit against Disney, claiming the company violated her agreement with Marvel that guaranteed \u003cem\u003eBlack Widow\u003c/em\u003e an exclusive theatrical release.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eEarlier this month, Disney released the movie in theaters and on its streaming service Disney+ for an additional $30. \u003cem\u003eBlack Widow\u003c/em\u003e earned $80 million at its opening weekend at the box office, a record for pandemic times, but not great for a Marvel movie.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFor reference, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eSpiderman: Far From Home\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (2019) brought in $185 million during its first weekend.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut \u003cem\u003eBlack Widow \u003c/em\u003emade a lot of money outside of theaters—$60 million from Disney+. And seeing all that $$$ ticked Johansson off: Her salary is largely tied to box office performance, which may have been siphoned off by the simultaneous at-home release. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDisney \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/film/news/disney-scarlett-johansson-black-widow-lawsuit-response-pandemic-1235030837/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresponded\u003c/a\u003e to Johansson by saying the lawsuit was \"especially sad and distressing in its callous disregard for the horrific and prolonged global effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eCompanies like Disney have thrown tens of billions into the streaming wars. The ScarJo case shows that the pivot to streaming has second-order effects—like how actors should be paid—that entertainment giants have yet to grapple with.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F07%2F29%2Fscarlett-johansson-sues-disney-black-widow-streaming-release\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81OTYzL3dvcmxkX21hc2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe're not at the free Peloton for a month stage of the new Covid wave yet, but lots more people are updating their mask collection.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSales of face masks \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-30a5f9b1cf1fd79d278f2401fb233134?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurged 24%\u003c/a\u003e for the week ending Tuesday, according to the Adobe Digital Economy Index. Analysts expect mask sales to jump even more after the CDC issued new guidance that encourages vaccinated people to wear masks indoors in Covid hotspots.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAfter a drop in demand, they're making a comeback\u003c/strong\u003e: Masks, which had accounted for 14% of gross merchandise sales on Etsy in Q2 2020, fell to a 3% share in Q1 this year. But after the new CDC guidance was released…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSearches for the term “masks” doubled on Google. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCitigroup, Apple stores, Disney World, and Disneyland moved quickly to require masks again.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOther retailers, juggling confused customers and anxious employees, are still waiting and watching.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut the boom times are probably over.\u003c/strong\u003e 3M, the manufacturer of N95 masks, said global demand reached its peak in Q1 2021. And although the worsening situation has sparked renewed interest in face coverings, analysts think even the recent surge in sales isn’t likely to vault the pandemic staple past the peak reached
